sentences.sContent: It would be an exaggeration to say that we were close friends.
sentences.sCn: 说我们是密友不免言过其实了。

sentences.sContent: It is no exaggeration to say that everyone will be affected by the new policy.
sentences.sCn: 说人人都会受到新政策的影响一点也不夸张。

sentences.sContent: The situation can be described, without exaggeration, as disastrous.
sentences.sCn: 可以毫不夸张地说，这是灾难性的局面。

synos.tran: 夸张；夸大之词；夸张的手法

remMethod.val: 来自exaggerate(v. 夸张， 夸大)

trans.tranOther: a statement or way of saying something that makes something seem better, larger etc than it really is
